intro: Theodorea alpina, commonly known as the alpine theodorea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, peppery scent when crushed. Theodorea alpina is typically found in rocky or alpine habitats and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments.
